required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Difference of Oropharyngeal Leak Pressure and Sealing Pressure Between New Supraglottic Airway Devices
clinical_study.official_title: The Difference of Oropharyngeal Leak Pressure and Sealing Pressure Between New Supraglottic Airway Devices

brief_summary.textblock: The difference of oropharyngeal leak pressure and sealing pressure between new supraglottic airway devices.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this clinical study, investigators want to discuss the issue that oropharyngeal leak pressure and sealing condition with different SGA including air-Q、i-gel、LMA-supreme、AMBU auragain 、ProSeal LMA and other new SGAs.
In the perioperative period, investigators documented respiratory function data including oropharyngeal leak pressure and peak airway pressure in these randomly selected SGA. Oropharyngeal leak pressure was measured by closing the expiratory valve of the circle system at fixed O2 flow 3L/min and noting the airway pressure at which the dial on a calibrated aneroid manometer reached equilibrium.
investigators wanted to compared the respiratory function between air-Q、i-gel、LMA-supreme、AMBU auragain、ProSeal LMA and other new SGAs during surgery and postoperative care unit.

secondary_outcome.measure: 1. The participant's head and neck position 2. The number of attempts required for SGA insertion 3. Ease of gastric tube placement 4. The ventilation score
secondary_outcome.description: The participant's head and neck position (neutral/extension/flexion/rotation) The number of attempts required for SGA insertion (1/2/3/tracheal intubation) Ease of gastric tube placement (success/failure/Leak) The ventilation score was scored from 0 to 3 based on three criteria: (1) No leakage with an airway pressure of > 15 cm H2O (2) Bilateral chest excursions with a peak inspiratory pressure of > 20 cm H2O (3) A Square Wave Capnography with each item scoring 0 or 1 point. Thus, if all three criteria were satisfied, the ventilation score was 3.

arm_group.description: Observe the function of SGA type 1
Observe the function of SGA type 2

study_pop.textblock: All general anesthesia patients who use SGA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. 20-80 years old.
2. ASA physical status I or II .
3. Without major organ dysfunction like heart, liver, brain, lung, kidney function failure.
Exclusion criteria:
1. BMI> 35 kg/m2.
2. Risk of aspiration(NPO clear water> 2 hours, solid foods > 8 hours).
3. Difficult airway like head and neck tumor or airway tumor.
4. Limited mouth opening (<2cm).
5. major organ dysfunction including heart, liver, brain, lung, kidney function failure.
6. Major surgery including open heart surgery, laparotomy general surgery, open chest surgery.
